name: global

properties.name: NaN
properties.description: The NaN global property is a predefined variable with the value NaN (Not-a-Number), as specified by the IEEE-754 standard.

properties.name: Infinity
properties.description: The Infinity global property is a predefined variable with the value for infinity.

properties.name: undefined
properties.description: This global property is a predefined variable with the value for an undefined value.

methods.name: encodeURI
methods.longdesc:
Create an UTF-8 ASCII encoded version of this string. The string is converted into UTF-8. Every non-alphanumeric character is encoded as a percent escape
						character of the form %xx, where xx is the hex value of the character. After the conversion to UTF-8 encoding and escaping, it is guaranteed that the string does not contain characters codes greater than 127. The list of characters not to be encoded is -_.!~*'();/?:@&=+$,#. The method returns false on errors.

methods.name: encodeURIComponent
methods.longdesc:
Create an UTF-8 ASCII encoded version of this string. The string is converted into UTF-8. Every non-alphanumeric character is encoded as a percent escape
						character of the form %xx, where xx is the hex value of the character. After the conversion to UTF-8 encoding and escaping, it is guaranteed that the string does not contain characters codes greater than 127. The list of characters not to be encoded is -_.!~*'(). The method returns false on errors.

methods.name: decodeURI
methods.description: Decodes a string created with encodeURI().

methods.name: decodeURIComponent
methods.description: Decodes a string created with encodeURIComponent().

methods.name: escape
methods.description: Creates a URL-encoded string from aString.
methods.longdesc: In the new string, characters of aString that require URL encoding are replaced with the format %xx, where xx is the hexadecimal value of the character code in the Unicode character set.  This format is used to transmit information appended to a URL during, for example, execution of the GET method.  Use the unescape() global function to translate the string back into its original format. Returns a string which is aString URL-encoded.

methods.name: eval
methods.description: Evaluates its argument as a JavaScript script, and returns the result of evaluation.
methods.longdesc: You can pass the result of an object's toSource() method to reconstruct that object.

methods.name: uneval
methods.description: Creates a source code representation of the supplied argument, and returns it as a string.

methods.name: isFinite
methods.description: Evaluates an expression and reports whether the result is a finite number.
methods.longdesc: Returns true if the expression is a finite number, false otherwise. False if the value is infinity or negative infinity.

methods.name: isNaN
methods.description: Evaluates an expression and reports whether the result is "Not-a-Number" (NaN).
methods.longdesc: Returns true if the result of evaluation is not a number (NaN), false if the value is a number.

methods.name: parseInt

parameters.name: text
parameters.description: The string from which to extract an integer.

parameters.name: base
parameters.description: The base of the string to parse (from base 2 to base 36).
parameters.longdesc: If not supplied, base is determined by the format of string.

methods.description: Extracts an integer from a string.
methods.longdesc: Parses a string to find the first set of characters, in a specified base, that can be converted to an integer, and returns that integer, or NaN if it does not encounter characters that it can convert to a number.

methods.name: parseFloat

parameters.name: text
parameters.description: The string from which to extract a floating point number.

methods.description: Extracts a floating-point number from a string.
methods.longdesc: Parses a string to find the first set of characters that can be converted to a floating point number, and returns that number, or NaN if it does not encounter characters that it can converted to a number.  The function supports exponential notation.

methods.name: unescape
methods.description: Translates URL-encoded string into a regular string, and returns that string.
methods.longdesc: Use the escape() global function to URL-encode strings.

methods.name: localize

parameters.name: what
parameters.description: The string to localize. A ZString-encoded string that can contain placeholder for additional arguments in the form %1 to %n.

parameters.name: argument
parameters.description: Optional argument(s) to be merged into the string. There may be more than one argument.

methods.description: Localizes a ZString-encoded string and merges additional arguments into the string.

methods.name: isXMLName
methods.description: Returns true if the supplied string is a valid XML name.

methods.name: setDefaultXMLNamespace

parameters.name: namespace
parameters.longdesc: Omit this parameter to return to the empty namespace. This is either a Namespace object or a string.

methods.longdesc: This is a replacement function for the standard JavaScript statement set default xml namespace.

parameters.name: title
parameters.description: The title of the alert; ignored on the Macintosh

parameters.name: errorIcon
parameters.description: Display an Error icon; ignored on the Macintosh

methods.name: confirm

parameters.name: noAsDefault
parameters.description: Set to true to set the No button as the default button

parameters.name: title
parameters.description: The title of the alert; ignored on the Macintosh

methods.description: Displays an alert box with Yes and No buttons; returns true for Yes

methods.name: prompt

parameters.name: default
parameters.description: The default text to preset the edit field with

methods.description: Displays a dialog allowing the user to enter text
methods.longdesc: Returns null if the user cancelled the dialog, the text otherwise

description: The global methods and properties for ExtendScript.
